identificationModule.briefTitle: The Causative Insects in Severe Insect Sting Allergy
identificationModule.officialTitle: Evaluating the Causative Insects in the Cases With Severe Insect Sting Allergy

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Study the causative insect by skin prick test and sIgE to wasp, bee and fire ants are important but false positive by crossreactivity can occur. sIgE to recombinant venom allergen is proposed to help in finding the causative insect.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Insect sting allergy from insects in Hymenoptera is not uncommon. The reaction maybe very severe and life threatening. To find the cause of insect sting allergy is important in prevention and specific treatment such as immunotherapy. The skin prick test and sIgE of these insects may have cross reactions so it is difficult to be interpreted.

The usage of sIgE recombinant venom allergen can benefit in separate cross reaction and dual allergy reaction.

armGroups.label: insect sting allergy
armGroups.description:
Skin prick tests to local and imported insect sting allergen with different concentration are performed.

sIgE Measurement (to insect and the recombinant venom)

interventions.name: Skin prick test
interventions.description: Skin prick tests to local and imported insect sting allergen with different concentration are performed.

interventions.name: sIgE measurement
interventions.description: sIgE levels to stinging insect allergen and their recombinant venom allergen are measured

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean wheal diameters of skin prick test of local and imported insect allergens
primaryOutcomes.description: Compare Mean wheal diameters of skin prick test of local and imported insect allergens at different concentrations

secondaryOutcomes.measure: specific IgE level to stinging insect allergen and recombinant venom allergens
secondaryOutcomes.description: compare skin prick test result and levels of specific IgE level to stinging insect allergen and recombinant venom allergens

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Cases with severe insect sting allergy reactions

Exclusion Criteria:

* Without other severe systemic diseases
* Not pregnant or lactation
